article.headline: Creighton 72, Drexel 48
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Cavel Witter scored 20 points and hit all 10 of his free throw attempts to lead Creighton to a 72-48 victory over Drexel on Saturday. Leading scorer Dane Watts added 10 points for the Blue Jays (5-0), who started out 5-0 for the first time since 2004-05. Tramayne Hawthorne scored 12 points for the Dragons (5-3, who lost their second straight. Drexel struggled for most of the game, going almost seven minutes without a field goal and committing 18 of their season-high 29 turnovers in the first half. Creighton used an 11-0 run to overcome its 1-for-13 shooting performance from behind the 3-point line and took a 31-18 lead at the break. The Dragons cut the margin to 48-36 at 7:19 in the second half, but the Blue Jays hit 10 straight free throws to take a 56-38 lead with 6:05 left. Creighton hit six straight from the line without losing possession after Randy Oveneke fouled Watts under Creighton's basket. After the foul, Oveneke and Drexel coach Bruiser Flint received technical fouls when Oveneke slammed the ball to the floor.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
